intro: Hutchinsia procumbens var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved hutchinsia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It features succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically smooth and unlobed, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathland and coastal dunes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
